intro: Campuloclinium ascendens, commonly known as the ascending campuloclinium, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
